io.prismic

Class Form.Search

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.prismic.Form.Search
  • Enclosing class:
    Form

    public static class Form.Search
extends Object
    The object you will use to perform queries. At the moment, only queries of the type "Search" exist in prismic.io's APIs. There is one named "everything", that allow to query through the while repository, and there is also one per collection created by prismic.io administrators in the writing-room. From an Api object, you get a Search form like this: api.getForm("everything"); Then, from a Search form, you query like this: search.query("[[:d = at(document.type, "Product")]]").ref(ref).submit();

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public Form.Search set(String field,
                       String value)
        Allows to set one of the form's fields, such as "q" for the query field, or the "ordering" field, or the "pageSize" field. The field must exist in the RESTful description that is in the /api document. To be on the safe side, you should use the specialized methods, and use searchForm.orderings(o) rather than searchForm.set("orderings", o) if they exist.
        Parameters:
        field - the name of the field to set
        value - the value with which to set it
        Returns:
        the current form, in order to chain those calls

      • set

        public Form.Search set(String field,
                       Integer value)
        A simple helper to set numeric value; see set(String,String).

      • ref

        public Form.Search ref(Ref ref)
        Allows to set the ref on which you wish to be performing the query. This is mandatory to submit a query; if you call api.getForm("everything").submit();, the kit will complain! Please do not forge the ref dynamically in this call, like this: ref(api.getMaster()). Prefer to set a ref variable once for your whole webpage, and use that variable in this method: ref(ref). That way, you can change this variable's assignment once, and trivially set your whole webpage into the future or the past.
        Parameters:
        ref - the ref object representing the ref on which you wish to query
        Returns:
        the current form, in order to chain those calls

      • ref

        public Form.Search ref(String ref)
        Allows to set the ref on which you wish to be performing the query. This is mandatory to submit a query; if you call api.getForm("everything").submit();, the kit will complain! Please do not forge the ref dynamically in this call, like this: ref(api.getMaster().getRef()). Prefer to set a ref variable once for your whole webpage, and use that variable in this method: ref(ref). That way, you can change this variable's assignment once, and trivially set your whole webpage into the future or the past.
        Parameters:
        ref - the ID of the ref on which you wish to query
        Returns:
        the current form, in order to chain those calls

      • query

        public Form.Search query(String q)
        Allows to set the query field of the current form. For instance: search.query("[[:d = at(document.type, "Product")]]"); Look up prismic.io's documentation online to discover the possible query predicates. Beware: a query is a list of predicates, therefore, it always starts with "[[" and ends with "]]".
        Parameters:
        q - the query to pass

      • submit

        public List<Document> submit()
        The method to call to perform and retrieve your query. Please make sure you're set a ref on this Search form before querying, or the kit will complain!
        Returns:
        the list of documents, that can be directly used as such.
